definition.name: Publish Docker
definition.description: Uses the git branch as the docker tag and pushes the container
definition.author: Lars Gohr

inputs.name: name
inputs.description: The name of the image you would like to push

inputs.name: username
inputs.description: The login username for the registry

inputs.name: password
inputs.description: The login password for the registry

inputs.name: registry
inputs.description: Use registry for pushing to a custom registry

inputs.name: snapshot
inputs.description: Use snapshot to push an additional image

inputs.name: default_branch
inputs.description: Set the default branch of your repository (default: master)

inputs.name: dockerfile
inputs.description: Use dockerfile when you would like to explicitly build a Dockerfile

inputs.name: workdir
inputs.description: Use workdir when you would like to change the directory for building

inputs.name: context
inputs.description: Use context when you would like to change the Docker build context.

inputs.name: buildargs
inputs.description: Use buildargs when you want to pass a list of environment variables as build-args

inputs.name: buildoptions
inputs.description: Use buildoptions when you want to configure options for building

inputs.name: cache
inputs.description: Use cache when you have big images, that you would only like to build partially

inputs.name: tags
inputs.description: Use tags when you want to bring your own tags (separated by comma)

inputs.name: tag_names
inputs.description: Use tag_names when you want to push tags/release by their git name

inputs.name: tag_semver
inputs.description: Push semver docker tags. e.g. image:1.2.3, image:1.2, image:1

inputs.name: no_push
inputs.description: Set no_push to true if you want to prevent the action from pushing to a registry (default: false)

inputs.name: platforms
inputs.description: Use platforms for building multi-arch images

outputs.name: tag
outputs.description: Is the tag, which was pushed

outputs.name: snapshot-tag
outputs.description: Is the tag that is generated by the snapshot-option and pushed

outputs.name: digest
outputs.description: Is the digest of the image, which was pushed
